page.title: 14WOODS AROUND AYMESTREY-FLORA
page.content: There are some privately owned areas of mixed deciduous woodland in the district but most of the larger areas belong to the{Forestry Commission}and these are predominately coniferous. Here the trees are:{SCOTS PINE,}can be harvested after 50 yrs and grows to height of 80ft;{SESSILE OAK,}planted in 24yd strips between the pines; {JAPANESE LARCH,}planted on edge of forest, and also a few self seeded SILVER BIRCH and a few BEECH. The acid soil under the trees only supports Foxglove and Bracken and some varieties of Fern but in Spring, before the canopy casts its shade grow Daffodil,Bluebell,Violet and primrose. Broom, Mallow, Rose-bay Willow Herb, and Ragged Robin grow on the edges of the forest. Blackberries,Raspberries Bilberries & a wide variety of lichens & moss are found on forest track banks
